meanings.definition: To remove the stigma or negative associations from something.
meanings.sent1: The campaign aimed to destigmatize mental health issues in the community.
meanings.sent2: The organization successfully destigmatized the discussion around addiction.
meanings.sent3: The funny skit destigmatized seeking help for a cold.
meanings.sent4: Her positive attitude destigmatized the idea of failure.
meanings.sent5: Through education, they destigmatized the misconceptions about disabilities.

meanings.definition: No longer viewed or treated with shame or disgrace.
meanings.sent1: The once destigmatized topic of therapy is now openly discussed.
meanings.sent2: She felt relieved when her condition was destigmatized by society.
meanings.sent3: The quirky hat destigmatized his outdated fashion sense.
meanings.sent4: The old building was destigmatized by the colorful murals painted on its walls.
meanings.sent5: The friendly atmosphere destigmatized the idea of being new to the group.
